title: House subcommittee advances five satellite-related bills
summary: A House Energy and Commerce subcommittee unanimously approved five space-related bills March 8, including legislation seeking to modernize regulations for satellites in non-geostationary orbit.

title: White House proposes $27.2 billion for NASA in 2024
summary: The White House is proposing a $27.2 billion budget for NASA in fiscal year 2024 that would include increased funding for Artemis and starting work on a tug to deorbit the International Space Station.

title: Biden budget seeks $27.2 billion for NASA, with increases for moon and Mars programs
summary: President Joe Biden is seeking to increase the budget for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to $27.2 billion next year, according to a proposed 2024 budget released Thursday.

title: Biden wants more money for the FAA after air travel disruptions
summary: The Biden administration is seeking additional funding for the Federal Aviation Administration, funds that aim to boost hiring of air traffic controllers and facilitate other improvements to manage increasingly congested airspace.

title: Investing in Space: Launch jitters
summary: It hasn’t mattered who you are, or how much time you’ve spent developing your rocket: The track record for debut launches is ruthless.

title: Tesat-Spacecom establishes U.S. subsidiary
summary: Tesat-Spacecom, a Germany-based manufacturer of optical terminals for communications satellites, announced March 9 it is establishing a U.S. subsidiary to support military and commercial programs.

title: SpaceX to launch OneWeb 17 mission and return booster to LZ-1
summary: SpaceX is set to launch 40 high-speed internet communication satellites to a polar low Earth orbit on the OneWeb 17 mission on Thursday. Launching from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida, the Falcon 9 is scheduled to lift off at 2:13 PM EST (19:13 UTC) and will mark SpaceX’s 16th orbital launch of 2023–a launch every 4.25 days.

title: Watch live: SpaceX launch and landing on tap today at Cape Canaveral
summary: SpaceX is set to launch a Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station Thursday with 40 more internet satellites for rival OneWeb, followed eight minutes later by the landing of the rocket’s first stage booster back at the Florida spaceport. Liftoff of the Falcon 9 rocket is set for 2:13 p.m. EST (1913 GMT).

title: Coverage Set as NASA’s SpaceX Crew-5 Prepares to Splashdown
summary: NASA will provide coverage of the agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 mission return to Earth from the International Space Station, beginning with undocking coverage live at 12 a.m. EST on Saturday, March 11. The SpaceX Dragon spacecraft is scheduled to undock from the space station at 2:05 a.m., to begin the journey home.

title: Japanese lunar lander company ispace to go public
summary: Japanese lunar exploration company ispace plans to list its shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange next month, just before the company attempts its first landing on the moon.
